result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both OWI (5th) [Modifiers: Penalties for Felonies-Class "H" Felony, Requirement for Ignition Interlock Device] and Operating w/ PAC (5th or 6th) [Modifiers: Alcohol Fine Enhancer, Penalties for Felonies-Class "H" Felony, Requirement for Ignition Interlock Device]. The defendant was found guilty of OWI (5th) [Modifiers: Penalties for Felonies-Class "H" Felony, Requirement for Ignition Interlock Device] and the other charge, Operating w/ PAC (5th or 6th) [Modifiers: Alcohol Fine Enhancer, Penalties for Felonies-Class "H" Felony, Requirement for Ignition Interlock Device] was dismissed by the court.

  • Ronald Wyman Hudson was found guilty of OWI (5th) [Modifiers: Penalties for Felonies-Class "H" Felony, Requirement for Ignition Interlock Device], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
***AMENDED***
Per Judge Scott R. Needham August 12, 2015 - If served in Minnesota it will be custodial, not on electronic monitoring, with work release.

Count 2 merged and dismissed.
Defendant to report to Probation today July 22, 2015.

 
In the event that the defendant is revoked or discharged from either probation or extended supervision with outstanding financial obligations, the supervising agent shall notify the court 10 days prior to the revocation or discharge.  A civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victim(s) and/or governmental entities for any balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect all debt.
AODA and follow any recommended treatment.

miscConds.notes: Apply bond on file, balance through a payment plan.

-Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia.
-Random and regular testing.
-Not to enter any business or establishment where the primary purpose is sale of alcohol.

timeConds.notes:
-Sentence to commence by October 1, 2015.
-Eligible for good time.
-Huber authorized for work.
-If served in Minnesota it will be custodial.

**AMENDED**

This bond to be en effect upon DE release from the first 48 hours in St. Croix County. 

Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times while this case is ongoing. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia.
Sentencing hearing on July 22, 2015 at 11:30 am.

Apprs: CO: SRN, Rpr: Kasten, Clerk: Evenson. ADA: Michael E. Nieskes DF ATTY: Julie A. Weber DF: Donald Wyman Hudson appeared. Case called at 9:09. ADA Nieskes makes recommendations. Atty. Weber agrees. DE has completed treatment. Court reads charge and maximum penalty. DE pleads G to Ct 1 in 14CF85. DE sworn. Crt reviews plea questionnaire and informs DE of rights. Crt finds DE freely, voluntarily and knowingly waives rights and makes plea. DE acknowledges 4 prior offenses. Attorney's stipulate to the facts. Crt accepts plea, finds factual basis and finds DE guilty OWI 5th offense of Ct 1 in 14CF85. On motion of the State, Crt merge and dismisses Ct 2 in 14CF85. Court revokes bond and remands DE to serve 48 hours in St. Croix County Jail.  Bond will be reinstated upon DE release after 48 hours.  
  Sentencing hearing scheduled for July 22, 2015 at 11:30 am.
Plea hearing on May 29, 2015 at 09:00 am.
